result.execSummary:
The defendant Tedric D Sanders was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, plus court costs, disbursements and fees. To be collected from DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid while on Extended supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.  Obtain GED or HSED.

Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
Parenting classes/counseling.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Urine screens.  No controlled substances or alcohol.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample if not previously taken.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.  Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tedric D Sanders

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (34 pages) commencing 01/20/2015 GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.
This case was retained by ADA Pucek; assigned ADA updated in CCAP accordingly.
Attorney Robert E Webb in court, defendant Tedric D Sanders not in court, in custody.  Dax Odom appeared on behalf of Jay R. Pucek for the State of Wisconsin. Case remains in trial posture.
No motions filed.  Motion portion of the 11/05/14 date is vacated; final pretrial remains.
Discharge Summary dated 9/08/14 from Justice Point, filed.

Attorney Robert E Webb in court, defendant Tedric D Sanders not in court, in custody. .   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  A new assistant district attorney will be assuming ADA Pucek's calendar and will try this case.   Defense counsel requested a trial date.  The following schedule for motions was set: movant to file by 9/24/14; response due by 10/14/14; reply due by 10/19/14.  All motions in limine, jury instructions and witness lists are due one week prior to the final pretrial date.  Alibi deadlines are per statute.  The 9/08/14 hearing date is vacated.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Email sent to ADA Pucek and his team captain notifying of dates set.
After case was called, Attorney Robert Webb came to this court and advised he has been retained and is now attorney of record.  Attorney Webb provided with next court date.

Defendant Tedric D Sanders not in court, defendant in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared on behalf of Jay R. Pucek for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is adjourned to 9/04/14 at 8:30 a.m.  on the same date defendant's new case is in Branch 25 for arraignment.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Wasserman advised this clerk that he is no longer counsel of record; Attorney Robert Webb was hired to represent defendant.  Message left for Attorney Webb.
Justice Point report received and filed.
/from Justice Point, filed.

Defendant Tedric D Sanders in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton, by telephone.  Defendant Tedric D Sanders in custody.  Jay R. Pucek appeared by telephone for the State of Wisconsin.  For reasons stated on the record, Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Status conference scheduled for August 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Violation Report (missed telephone contact) received and filed.
/from Justice Point, received and filed.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State's police witnesses are present in court.  Justice Point caseworker notified the court that the defendant's mother contacted her and indicated that the defendant was admitted to the hospital.  Court issued and stayed a bench warrant to the next court date selected in concert with the officers' availability.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
/from Justice Point, filed.

Defendant Tedric D Sanders in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court grants Defense motion for sequestration of  witnesses.  State's in-court officer:  Detective Sment.  Defense motion to suppress statements proceeds.  Sworn for the State:  Detecitve Steven Sment, Wauwatosa Police Department.  State rests.  Court had colloquy with defendant regarding his right to testify and not to testify; defendant elects not to testify.  Court found defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to to testify.  Defense rests.  Arguments heard.  Court denied defense motion to suppress statements (confession).  

Court held stop motion in abeyance and scheduled the matter for motion hearing on 8/14/14 at 1:30 p.m.  Court ordered all conditions of bail to continue.
/to Suppress Evidence After Illegal Stop, Search and Arrest, received and filed.
Notice of Motion and Motion To Suppress Evidence After Illegal Stop, Search and Arrest, Filed by Attorney Danielle L. Shelton
/and Memorandum in Support of Motion to Suppress Statement, received and filed.
/from Justice Point, received and filed. rn

Defendant Tedric D Sanders in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Jay R Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a motion date; motion to suppress statement (Miranda-Goodchild).  Movant to file by 5/30/14; State's response due by 6/13/14; defense reply due by 6/20/14.    Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  All conditions of bail are to continue.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tedric D Sanders in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Jay R Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Steven Stent.    Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #11CF5066 that are attached to the complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

14RM020624  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04-15-14

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Tedric D Sanders in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Defendant Tedric D Sanders in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
